バグゲーです。サバイバーが有利とかキラーが有利とか人によって意見が違いますががっつり対戦だと思って買うならやめましょう。このゲームはバグと戦いながら子供同士の喧嘩のように追っかけっこして煽ったり煽られたりするゲームです。勝ち負けなんてものはありません明確に勝ちとか負けとかはありませんポイントを稼げればそれでいいんです。あとは自分でロールプレイをして楽しむだけですかね絶対仲間を見捨てないとか他人を犠牲にするとか自己犠牲するとか。しかし、バグを楽しむのが一番です。治してもさらなるバグが出てきてそのバグに文句言ったりそれを使うプレイヤーにイライラしたりそれをわざわざ晒してるあふぉに呆れたりして楽しむゲームです。ゲーム内容は楽しいのでイライラしないなら買いましょう、ストレスをお金で買うのはやめましょう。
I think we did Pretty good job so far

The state of this game varies. They update it a lot and it does change the way it plays quite a bit. I'm rather fond of a lot of their changes so far actually. Though often enough, when they fix one issue they create others.
Some good things about the game:
I found the idea really enticing initially, and I really enjoyed the first hundred hours. I was immersed. This game is at it's best when survivors will risk their own survival to keep one another alive, when the killer is good, but doesn't stomp your team, and it actually requires survivors to not make too many mistakes to survive.
I LOVED how survivors ended up having a sense of camaradarie, both as a killer and a survivor. As a killer, it gives you more chances to get another sacrifice. As a survivor, it gives you another chance to save private ryan, but also gives a feel good feeling.
The game is at it's best when there's a struggle for both sides.
The creators are trying to push the survivors to be less toxic, making farming hooks less profitable.
The creators patches seem to be moving in the right direction.

Here's the bad side:
Then I found out about how the community can be pretty toxic. Survivors will just flat out just disconnect against one killer, and bully other killers. It's understandable when survivors act cowardly because they're scared, and I don't consider being a coward being toxic in this game. However, there are disconnects because the survivors get outplayed by a killer every few games. There will be games where some survivors and or killer will just randomly choose to farm the whole game. There will be some games where a survivor will pull you off the hook in front of the killer over and over until you're dead. Some games where the killer will tunnel or camp you until you're dead. All of these ruin the game for you. Sometimes I'll have a bunch of good games in a row, and sometimes I'll have most of games ruined by one of these happenstances. 

Keep in mind, the killers are SUPPOSED to eventually catch you, the mind games just make it possible for the killer to catch you much faster. However, a lot of killers are just worse than the rest, BECAUSE of just how long they might need to actually catch the survivor. A lot of the times, a survivor has to make mistakes for the killer to catch them, and if they don't the killer can get chased for way too long.
The killer also has to work twice as hard to rank up than a survivor. I'm not sure why that was changed recently. I dislike that change, because the killers have less reason to be merciful. Killers used to give the last survivor the hatch often if they wanted to, but now they NEED that last death.
Another big failing the game has on the killer side is the fact that almost every killer NEEDS the perk ruin. They just can't catch survivors fast enough to warrant NOT having ruin. It's in almost every game. 

Overall, if you're into these types of community games, buy it on sale. You'll think it's worth your money if you do for sure.
